comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Architecture, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 64848937@N00
comment._content: This is actually, the Old Irish Parliament Buildings which were sold to the progenitor of the Bank of Ireland.  I think the title should be changed to reflect the correct name.  The parliament was dissolved by act of Union at the start of the 19th century.  It is still one of the Georgian set-pieces in the capital.

comment.author: 8621180@N04
comment._content: I wouldnt change the name considering by the time this print was made the building was owned by Band of Ireland.. perhaps add in "former Parliament House" - but the "Correct" name is definitely Bank of Ireland. I could be wrong but... if it is printed on the image itself then it must have been Bank of Ireland at the time..

comment.author: 20907201@N03
comment._content: Wow this is amazing, College Green without all the people, cars and buses... -- Seen in a discussion of the group "Flickr Commons" (?)

comment.author: 64848937@N00
comment._content: Dunwho - you clearly do not subscribe to the view in geographical circles that to name something is to own it!  :)  Here's a question for you - if it was an image of the Parthenon from the 18th century would you describe it as a stable - as that is what it was used for at the time?

comment.author: 35075914@N06
comment._content: dunwho falls closest to the "ethics" of cataloging: to present an item as its publisher or creator intended.  Other titles and names can and should be added as notes or tags - as resources allow!  doctorbob, why not add tags to indicate original purpose of this building? Current name?
